agency_desc: A commercial organization with treatment centers throughout Indiana that provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. A virtual intensive outpatient program is available for those not needing residential treatment.
service_description: Provides a 28-day inpatient residential detox and addiction treatment for alcohol and substances, including heroin, methamphetamine, cocaine, and prescription pills. Co-occurring disorders such as depression, anxiety, PTSD, and trauma are also treated.
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Residential Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_details: Self-referring: Call for information or to schedule intake. -- Medical/Mental health provider referring: Call, email or fax referral and supporting documentation.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- In need of inpatient alcohol and/or substance use detox or treatment -- Medically stable -- Able to complete activities of daily living (showering, dressing, feeding etc.) -- Able and willing to participate in mandatory programming from day one

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A community health clinic that specializes in family health care and offers clinical services on behalf of the Parke County Health Department.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Parke County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Parke County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Parke County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Parke County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Parke County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Mon-Fri 8am-noon and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_name: NORTH CENTRAL PARKE COMMUNITY SCHOOL CORPORATION
agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
site_name: NORTH CENTRAL PARKE COMMUNITY SCHOOL CORPORATION
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_name: WABASH RIVER CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers career and technical education programs, adult education and high school equivalency classes, and provides a test site for the high school equivalency exam.
site_name: WABASH RIVER CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place monthly and is available in paper format only.
site_details: Call for information or to register. All documentation, identification, and payment must be received at least one week in advance of the test date.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based organization that provides charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open -- Limit one (1) visit each calendar month

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open; age 17 or younger must be supervised -- For a library card: Living, working, or owning property in Parke County (except Reserve Township)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Parke County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Parke County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 4pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 4pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property Parke County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Parke County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Parke County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Montezuma in Parke County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Montezuma in Parke County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the Parke County Sheriff.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides recycling information and services.
service_description: Provides annual events for residents of Putnam and Parke counties to dispose of hazardous waste including appliances, non-controlled medications, fuel and gasoline, antifreeze, motor oil and filters, electronics, fluorescent bulbs, CFL bulbs, household cleaners, herbicides, fertilizers, pool chemicals, and small propane tanks. Accepts tires and televisions at a reduced rate during this event.
site_details: Visit the website or call for details.
site_eligibility: Parke and Putnam County residents households; no business or commercial waste

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Parke County Circuit Court, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Parke County Courts

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Rockville and Adams Township in Park County.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to household in need, when funds are available.
site_details: Call or walk in for an application.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Rockville or in Adams Township -- Homeowners or renters -- Financial need

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services in the town of Rockville in Parke County.
service_description: Maintains public parks and provides recreational programming in the town of Rockville in Parke County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services in the town of Rockville in Parke County.
service_description: Offers a park and public pool, open to the public seasonally.
site_details: Walk in or call to confirm hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers.
service_description: Provides electric service to portions of Clay, Fountain, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, and Vigo counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location. -- Walk in for new service or apply online.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries -- In Clay County: Parts of Brazil, Dick Johnson, Jackson, and Van Buren townships -- In Fountain County: Parts of Jackson and Mill Creek townships -- In Montgomery County: Parts of Brown, Ripley, Scott, and Union townships  -- In Park County: Parts of Adams, Jackson, Florida, Raccoon, Reserve, and Wabash townships and all of Greene, Howard, Liberty, Penn, Sugar Creek, Union, and Washington townships -- In Putnam: Parts of Cloverdale, Clinton, Floyd, Franklin, Greencastle, Madison, Monroe, Russell, Warren, and Washington townships -- In Vigo: Parts of Nevins and Otter Creek townships

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list is currently open and applications are being accepted. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Living in Parke County -- Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization that offers emergency limited financial assistance to those living in Parke County.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for gasoline, utilities, food vouchers, rent, and non-narcotic prescription expenses for persons in need living in Parke County. Assistance is based on funding and individual assessment.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail for a return call the next business day.
site_schedule: By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
By appointment only; voicemail available daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education, intervention, and supportive services, including domestic violence and sexual assault victim advocacy, healthy families, and the Putnam County Recovery Coalition.
site_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA - PARKE COUNTY
service_name: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT PROGRAM - PARKE COUNTY
service_description: Provides support, education, and advocacy to men and women who have been victims of violence. Services include court advocacy, protective orders, safe shelter, domestic violence education, safety plans, referrals, support groups, on-going support, educational groups, and awareness programming.
site_details: Call and ask for advocate. -- For after hours emergencies, call 9-1-1, 765-655-1295, or county dispatch.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Female, male, or transgender -- Direct and indirect victims of domestic violence

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers pregnancy testing, abortion alternatives, and support services to pregnant women and new mothers.
site_name: PARKE VERMILLION COMMUNITY PREGNANCY CENTER - ROCKVILLE
service_description: Offers a parenting education program for moms and dads. Topics include parenting skills, newborn care, budgeting, and more. Participants earn coupons that may be used in the Family Store for baby and household items.
site_details: Call for enrollment information.
site_schedule: Clinton Location: Thurs 3pm-7pm -- Rockville Location: Mon 1pm-7pm; Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-2pm
Clinton Location: Thurs 3pm-7pm -- Rockville Location: Mon 1pm-7pm; Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-2pm
Clinton Location: Thurs 3pm-7pm -- Rockville Location: Mon 1pm-7pm; Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-2pm
Clinton Location: Thurs 3pm-7pm -- Rockville Location: Mon 1pm-7pm; Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-2pm
Clinton Location: Thurs 3pm-7pm -- Rockville Location: Mon 1pm-7pm; Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-2pm
site_eligibility: Expectant or parenting moms and dads (with children age 5 or under)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for all veteran issues, including providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Parke County and surrounding counties -- Veterans and surviving spouses and children of veterans.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Parke County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Rockville in Parke County

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - PARKE COUNTY
service_description: Provides individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children. Psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services are also available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment) -- Living in Clay, Montgomery, Parke, Putnam, Vermillion, or Vigo county
